solution_line_template: Dora made {dora_rate} cupcakes per hour for {total_hours} hours for a total of {dora_rate}*{total_hours} = <<{dora_rate}*{total_hours}={dora_total}>>{dora_total} cupcakes
Betty took a {betty_break}-hour break so she spent {total_hours}-{betty_break} = <<{total_hours}-{betty_break}={betty_hours}>>{betty_hours} hours making cupcakes
Betty made {betty_rate} cupcakes per hour for {betty_hours} hours for a total of {betty_rate}*{betty_hours} = <<{betty_rate}*{betty_hours}={betty_total}>>{betty_total} cupcakes
The difference between the number of cupcakes they made is {dora_total}-{betty_total} = <<{dora_total}-{betty_total}={difference}>>{difference} cupcakes
